hackathon-description-text: Here's a guide to help you submit your project: bit.ly/hackathon-submissions
hackathon-eligibility: Undergraduate students. Teams of 2-5 students can qualify for prizes.
hackathon-rules:
You must present your project in person in order to be eligible for and win prizes. Furthemore, the project must have been started at WHACK. 
We abide by MLH's Code of Conduct: https://static.mlh.io/docs/mlh-code-of-conduct.pdf

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The first place team (up to 5 people max) will win $70 Amazon Gift Cards
The first place team (up to 5 people max) will win $50 Amazon Gift Cards
The third place team (up to 5 people max) will win $30 Amazon Gift Cards
This team consists of all first-time hackers (up to 5 people max) and will win sleeping bags and $2000 scholarships to attend Make School's Summer Academy.

Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: This team of 2-5 students will win $2000 scholarships to attend Make School's Summer Academy.
This team of 2-5 students will win $2000 scholarships to attend Make School's Summer Academy.
Each member of the winning team will receive $500 Airbnb Travel Coupons.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=106 Central St, Wellesley, MA 02481, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How interesting/innovative is the idea of this project?
How well does this project implement its goals?
What is the potential scalability of this project?

hackathon-description-header: WHACK is a community that supports women in tech. This Spring's theme is Hacking the Glass Ceiling.
